flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
Additional Materials Required:

  • Soil Loading Drawer
  • Wide Cylinder Supports
  • 3/4"x2" Bolts (8)
  • 3/4" Galvanized Nuts (8)
guide.introduction_rendered:
Additional Materials Required:

  • Soil Loading Drawer
  • Wide Cylinder Supports
  • 3/4"x2" Bolts (8)
  • 3/4" Galvanized Nuts (8)
Tools
  • Hydraulic Pump

lines.text: Attach the cylinder to a hydraulic pump or power cube and contract the cylinder at least 1".
lines.text_raw: Attach the cylinder to a hydraulic pump or power cube and contract the cylinder at least 1".

lines.text: Stand up the frame so the press feet are facing down.
lines.text_raw: Stand up the frame so the press feet are facing down.

lines.text: Insert the Soil loading drawer on top of the horizontal members so that the press plate is facing the press feet.
lines.text_raw: Insert the Soil loading drawer on top of the horizontal members so that the press plate is facing the press feet.

lines.text: If the drawer doesn't fit because of the spacers, you welded them too close. Grind off the tacks and tack them a little higher.
lines.text_raw: If the drawer doesn't fit because of the spacers, you welded them too close. Grind off the tacks and tack them a little higher.

lines.text: Position the drawer so that the press plate will be fully contacted by the press feet.
lines.text_raw: Position the drawer so that the press plate will be fully contacted by the press feet.

lines.text: Bolt the drawer members on snugly.
lines.text_raw: Bolt the drawer members on snugly.

lines.text: Use the pump to expand the cylinder as much as possible. The pump will likely stall out.
lines.text_raw: Use the pump to expand the cylinder as much as possible. The pump will likely stall out.

lines.text: If the pump stalls, turn it back on and expand it fully once more.
lines.text_raw: If the pump stalls, turn it back on and expand it fully once more.

lines.text: Contract it, so you can weld the spacers in. Then detach from the pump.
lines.text_raw: Contract it, so you can weld the spacers in. Then detach from the pump.

lines.text: Look where the spacers are near the drawer.
lines.text_raw: Look where the spacers are near the drawer.

lines.text: The spacers should be very close to the drawer (less than 1/32") See quality control video if you wonder why.
lines.text_raw: The spacers should be very close to the drawer (less than 1/32") See [http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=mh7XqmTbA0g|quality control video] if you wonder why.

lines.text: If they are too far, grind off the welds and re-tack them so they are lightly contacting the drawer. Yet again, make sure they are perfectly square with the verticals.
lines.text_raw: If they are too far, grind off the welds and re-tack them so they are lightly contacting the drawer. Yet again, make sure they are perfectly square with the verticals.

guide.summary: Stretch the frame on your Compressed Earth Brick Press.
guide.title: CEB: Stretching the Frame
